segment.source: Device Portal API reference for HoloLens
segment.target: Device Portal API reference for HoloLens

segment.source: Learn about the Windows Device Portal for HoloLens REST API's that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.
segment.target: Learn about the Windows Device Portal for HoloLens REST API's that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.

segment.source: Device Portal API reference for HoloLens
segment.target: Device Portal API reference for HoloLens

segment.source: Everything in the Windows Device Portal is built on top of REST API's that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.
segment.target: Everything in the Windows Device Portal is built on top of REST API's that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.

segment.source: Get HTTPS requirements for the Device Portal
segment.target: Get HTTPS requirements for the Device Portal

segment.source: You can get the HTTPS requirements for the Device Portal by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the HTTPS requirements for the Device Portal by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can get the stored IPD value by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the stored IPD value by using the following request format.

segment.source: The value is returned in millimeters.
segment.target: The value is returned in millimeters.

segment.source: Get a list of HoloLens specific ETW providers
segment.target: Get a list of HoloLens specific ETW providers

segment.source: You can get a list of HoloLens specific ETW providers that are not registered with the system by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get a list of HoloLens specific ETW providers that are not registered with the system by using the following request format.

segment.source: Return the state for all active services
segment.target: Return the state for all active services

segment.source: You can get the state of all services that are currently running by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the state of all services that are currently running by using the following request format.

segment.source: Set the HTTPS requirement for the Device Portal.
segment.target: Set the HTTPS requirement for the Device Portal.

segment.source: You can set the HTTPS requirements for the Device Portal by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can set the HTTPS requirements for the Device Portal by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) Determines whether or not HTTPS is required for the Device Portal.
segment.target: (required) Determines whether or not HTTPS is required for the Device Portal.

segment.source: Possible values are yes, no, and default.
segment.target: Possible values are yes, no, and default.

segment.source: You can set the stored IPD by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can set the stored IPD by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The new IPD value to be stored.
segment.target: (required) The new IPD value to be stored.

segment.source: This value should be in millimeters.
segment.target: This value should be in millimeters.

segment.source: Accept websocket upgrades and run a mirage client that sends updates
segment.target: Accept websocket upgrades and run a mirage client that sends updates

segment.source: You can accept websocket upgrades and run a mirage client that sends updates at 30 fps by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can accept websocket upgrades and run a mirage client that sends updates at 30 fps by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: A value of active forces visual tracking mode when it can't be established passively.
segment.target: A value of active forces visual tracking mode when it can't be established passively.

segment.source: Get the thermal stage of the device
segment.target: Get the thermal stage of the device

segment.source: You can get the thermal stage of the device by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the thermal stage of the device by using the following request format.

segment.source: The possible values are indicated by the following table.
segment.target: The possible values are indicated by the following table.

segment.source: Create a control stream or post data to a created stream
segment.target: Create a control stream or post data to a created stream

segment.source: You can create a control stream or post data to a created stream by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can create a control stream or post data to a created stream by using the following request format.

segment.source: The posted data is expected to be of type application/octet-stream.
segment.target: The posted data is expected to be of type application/octet-stream.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required if creating a control stream) Indicates the priority of the stream.
segment.target: (required if creating a control stream) Indicates the priority of the stream.

segment.source: (required if posting to a created stream) The identifier for the stream to post to.
segment.target: (required if posting to a created stream) The identifier for the stream to post to.

segment.source: You can delete a control stream by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can delete a control stream by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can open a web socket connection for a control stream by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can open a web socket connection for a control stream by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can get the simluation mode by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the simluation mode by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can set the simulation mode by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can set the simulation mode by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: Possible values include default, simulation, remote, and legacy.
segment.target: Possible values include default, simulation, remote, and legacy.

segment.source: You can delete a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can delete a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording to delete.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording to delete.

segment.source: You can get all the available recordings by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get all the available recordings by using the following request format.

segment.source: Get the types of data in a loaded recording
segment.target: Get the types of data in a loaded recording

segment.source: You can get the types of data in a loaded recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the types of data in a loaded recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording you are interested in.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording you are interested in.

segment.source: You can get all the loaded recordings by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get all the loaded recordings by using the following request format.

segment.source: Get the current playback state of a recording
segment.target: Get the current playback state of a recording

segment.source: You can get the current playback state of a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the current playback state of a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording that you are interested in.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording that you are interested in.

segment.source: You can load a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can load a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording to load.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording to load.

segment.source: You can pause a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can pause a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording to pause.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording to pause.

segment.source: You can play a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can play a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording to play.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording to play.

segment.source: You can stop a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can stop a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording to stop.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording to stop.

segment.source: You can unload a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can unload a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the recording to unload.
segment.target: (required) The name of the recording to unload.

segment.source: You can upload a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can upload a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can get the current recording state by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the current recording state by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can start a recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can start a recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: There can only be one active recording at a time.
segment.target: There can only be one active recording at a time.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record head data.
segment.target: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record head data.

segment.source: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record hands data.
segment.target: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record hands data.

segment.source: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record spatial mapping data.
segment.target: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record spatial mapping data.

segment.source: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record environment data.
segment.target: (see below) Set this value to 1 to indicate the system should record environment data.

segment.source: (optional) Set this value to 1 to indicate that only a single sptial mapping frame should be recorded.
segment.target: (optional) Set this value to 1 to indicate that only a single sptial mapping frame should be recorded.

segment.source: For these parameters, exactly one of the following parameters must be set to 1: head, hands, spatialMapping, or environment.
segment.target: For these parameters, exactly one of the following parameters must be set to 1: head, hands, spatialMapping, or environment.

segment.source: You can stop the current recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can stop the current recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: The recording will be returned as a file.
segment.target: The recording will be returned as a file.

segment.source: Delete a mixed reality capture (MRC) recording from the device
segment.target: Delete a mixed reality capture (MRC) recording from the device

segment.source: You can delete an MRC recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can delete an MRC recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the video file to delete.
segment.target: (required) The name of the video file to delete.

segment.source: The name should be hex64 encoded.
segment.target: The name should be hex64 encoded.

segment.source: Download a mixed reality capture (MRC) file
segment.target: Download a mixed reality capture (MRC) file

segment.source: You can download an MRC file from the device by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can download an MRC file from the device by using the following request format.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (required) The name of the video file you want to get.
segment.target: (required) The name of the video file you want to get.

segment.source: The name should be hex64 encoded.
segment.target: The name should be hex64 encoded.

segment.source: (optional) Set this value to stream if you want to download a stream.
segment.target: (optional) Set this value to stream if you want to download a stream.

segment.source: Get the mixed reality capture (MRC) settings
segment.target: Get the mixed reality capture (MRC) settings

segment.source: You can get the MRC settings by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the MRC settings by using the following request format.

segment.source: Get the status of the mixed reality capture (MRC) recording
segment.target: Get the status of the mixed reality capture (MRC) recording

segment.source: You can get the MRC recording status by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the MRC recording status by using the following request format.

segment.source: The possible values include running and stopped.
segment.target: The possible values include running and stopped.

segment.source: Get the list of mixed reality capture (MRC) files
segment.target: Get the list of mixed reality capture (MRC) files

segment.source: You can get the MRC files stored on the device by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can get the MRC files stored on the device by using the following request format.

segment.target: Set the mixed reality capture (MRC) settings

segment.source: You can set the MRC settings by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can set the MRC settings by using the following request format.

segment.target: Starts a mixed reality capture (MRC) recording

segment.target: You can start an MRC recording by using the following request format.

segment.target: Stop the current mixed reality capture (MRC) recording

segment.source: You can stop the current MRC recording by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can stop the current MRC recording by using the following request format.

segment.source: Take a mixed reality capture (MRC) photo
segment.target: Take a mixed reality capture (MRC) photo

segment.source: You can take an MRC photo by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can take an MRC photo by using the following request format.

segment.source: The photo is returned in JPEG format.
segment.target: The photo is returned in JPEG format.

segment.source: Initiates a chunked download of a fragmented mp4
segment.target: Initiates a chunked download of a fragmented mp4

segment.source: You can initiate a chunked download of a fragmented mp4 by using the following request format.
segment.target: You can initiate a chunked download of a fragmented mp4 by using the following request format.

segment.source: This API uses the default quality.
segment.target: This API uses the default quality.

segment.source: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:
segment.target: You can specify the following additional parameters on the request URI:

segment.source: (optional) Indiates whether to capture the PV camera.
segment.target: (optional) Indiates whether to capture the PV camera.

segment.source: (optional) Indiates whether to capture the microphone.
segment.target: (optional) Indiates whether to capture the microphone.

segment.source: (optional) Indiates whether to capture the application audio.
segment.target: (optional) Indiates whether to capture the application audio.
